Welcome to EmotionsDetector’s documentation!¶

Node classes for one-way linked structures and two-way linked structures.

Representing EmotionsList ADT

class modules.emotion_list.emotions_list.EmotionsList(database)¶

Representing EmotionsList ADT that preserves emotions and their probabilities

get_emotions_probability()¶

() -> DynamicArray Returns an array with emotions of the tweet and their probabilities and adds to the array

get_tweet_emotion()¶

() -> str Returns a main emotion of the tweet and adds to the array

set_tweet(tweet)¶

(str) -> Sets tweet which the ADT will analyze

Represents a list with STOPWORDS

Represents a function to generate data from Twitter API

modules.twitter_list_adt.generate_json.generate_data(nickname)¶

(str) -> dict Returns a dictionary with information about the user’s tweets

Representing a TweetsLinkedList ADT

class modules.twitter_list_adt.tweets_linked_list.TweetsLinkedList(nickname)¶

Representing a TweetsLinkedList ADT based on linked structure

property available_dates¶

() -> DynamicArray Returns a list with the dates on which user wrote tweets

create_linked()¶

() -> Creates linked structure in which each node stores the text and date of the tweet, and in the first node a description of the user

get_tweet_by_day(day)¶

(str) -> DynamicArray Returns a list of tweets that have been written at given day

Represents a class Functional

class modules.program_process.functional.Functional¶

Manages a process of the program_process

available_days()¶

() -> list Returns a list with the dates on which user wrote tweets

many_emotions_last_time()¶

() -> list Returns a list with emotions and their probabilities for last time

many_emotions_specific_day(day)¶

(str) -> list Returns a list with emotions and their probabilities for a specific day

one_emotion_last_time(emotion)¶

(str) -> tuple Returns the emotion and its probability for last time

one_emotion_specific_day(emotion, day)¶

(str) -> tuple Returns the emotion and its probability for a specific day

set_nickname(nickname)¶

(str) -> Sets nickname of the user with which the program works

two_emotions_last_time()¶

() -> list Returns a list divided into positive and negative emotions with their probabilities for last time

two_emotions_specific_day(day)¶

(str) -> list Returns a list divided into positive and negative emotions with their probabilities for a specific day

Represents a dashboard with charts and statistics

modules.visualization.dashboard.create_dash_app(server, counter, manager, app_type, nickname, day=None, emotion=None)¶

(Flask, int, Functional, str, str, str, str) -> Dash Returns a dashboard with statistics according to the given parameters (for a specific day, for a specific emotion, etc.)

modules.visualization.dashboard.dashboard_emotions(flask_app, counter, main_text, figure1, figure2)¶

(Flask, int, str, Figure, Figure) -> Dash Returns a dashboard with the given figures and text using dash

Represents bar and pie charts made with plotly

modules.visualization.plots.create_lists(emotions_list)¶

(EmotionsList) -> list, list, list Creates lists with emotions, probabilities and colors to create charts

modules.visualization.plots.plot_bar(emotions_list)¶

(EmotionsList) -> Figure Creates a bar chart with statistics using emotions_list

modules.visualization.plots.plot_circle(emotions_list)¶

(EmotionsList) -> Figure Creates a pie chart with statistics using emotions_list
